title: Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Job
name: Job
description: Jobs are objects that manage asynchronous tasks such as running queries, loading data, and exporting data.

params.name: location
params.description: A default geographic location, used when no job metadata exists.

methods.name: exists
methods.description: Check whether or not the job exists.

methods.name: cancel
methods.description:
Requests that a job be cancelled. You will need to poll the job to ensure the cancel request successfully goes through.

Please note that by default the library will not attempt to retry this call on your behalf.

methods.name: queryResults
methods.description:
Retrieves the results of a query job.

Please note this method will trigger an initial network request, but further polling may be necessary in order to access the full query results. Polling for completion can be initiated by iterating on the returned Google\Cloud\BigQuery\QueryResults, or by calling either Google\Cloud\BigQuery\QueryResults::rows() or Google\Cloud\BigQuery\QueryResults::waitUntilComplete().

params.name: options.maxResults
params.description: Maximum number of results to read per page.

params.name: options.initialTimeoutMs
params.description: How long, in milliseconds, to wait for query results to become available before timing out. Defaults to 0 milliseconds (0 seconds). Please note that this option is used only for the initial call to get query results. To control the timeout for any subsequent calls while polling for query results to complete, please see the $timeoutMs option.

params.name: options.timeoutMs
params.description: How long, in milliseconds, each API call will wait for query results to become available before timing out. Depending on whether the $maxRetries has been exceeded, the results will be polled again after the timeout has been reached. Defaults to 10000 milliseconds (10 seconds). Please note that this option is used when iterating on the returned class, and will not apply immediately upon calling of this method.

params.name: options.maxRetries
params.description: The number of times to poll the Job status, until the job is complete. By default, will poll indefinitely. Please note that this option is used when iterating on the returned class, and will not block immediately upon calling of this method.

params.name: options.maxRetries
params.description: The number of times to poll the Job status, until the job is complete. By default, will poll indefinitely.

exceptions.description:
If the maximum number of retries while waiting for
job completion has been exceeded.

methods.name: isComplete
methods.description: Checks the job's completeness. Useful in combination with Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Job::reload() to poll for job status.

methods.name: info
methods.description: Retrieves the job's details. If no job data is cached a network request will be made to retrieve it.

methods.name: reload
methods.description: Triggers a network request to reload the job's details.

examples.code:
echo $job->isComplete(); // false
sleep(1); // let's wait for a moment...
$job->reload(); // execute a network request
echo $job->isComplete(); // true

methods.name: identity
methods.description:
Retrieves the job's identity.

An identity provides a description of a nested resource.
